40338600.review:
[b]This is one of my new favorite games, but will it be yours?[/b]

Created by one person, Iconoclasts is a story-critical platformer with metroidvania stages, unique bosses and simple puzzles.  

You play as the silent (but not mute) protaganist, Robin.  A talented young mechanic with a mean stun gun, a giant wrench, your smarts and a big heart.  Throw the mechanic into the problems of the world and she will try to fix them.  But, what do they say about good intentions?

Let's break it down!

[h1]Art:[/h1]
The screenshots won't do it justice.  Each character has a plethora of different sprites for each expression rather than just text and it's fun to notice new reactions even late game.  On environments: the art has a pretty unique eye-popping style.  Just look at the screenshots above... notice the common shapes used.  There is more going on then just form over function.  Even from the start, you may unwittingly notice foreshadowing.  There's an attention to detail that can easily go overlooked and unappreciated.  But, when you've played through, you may notice all the visual cues that were there.  Personally, it wasn't my favorite style, but it never failed to look good.  Iconoclasts wins big with the art category, and it was made by one person.

[h1]Music:[/h1]
Some games have just a few tracks used throughout the game.  And then you have Iconoclasts.  With 50+ tracks, you'll never fail to have a theme that fits the situation, and it was made by one person.  Like the artwork, the music may be hit or miss with your tastes, but they too compliment the visuals well in maintaing a theme.  If you don't mind small track name spoilers, take a peek at the official soundtrack on youtube:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wK9BYVfRzMw
Even if it doesn't resonate with you, it's not boring!

[h1]Controls:[/h1]
I played using a PS3 controller using an Xbox profile and much prefer it to my limited time on the keyboard.  If I remember correctly, the game felt a bit complicated at the start.  You aren't given hand holding tutorials and baby steps.  Most of the time you are thrown into the air, expected to fly.  This was fine.  Given visual cues and signs, your expected actions are taught in a natural visual way.  For example, you have access to multiple techniques at the start that would make life easier, but you don't know how to perform them if you are just starting out.  Meaning you'll develop and evolve your technique of dealing with areas over the course of the game.  Some people want a universal control scheme... but I appreciate trying something somewhat new.  Learning the differences and adapting.

Oh and I should mention movement is very fluid, and forgiving.  Even after running off the edge of a cliff, you'll have just enough time to perform a jump so you'll rarely be frustrated with precision.  And a personal favorite of mine, how many times have you mashed a button to fly through text and accidently pressed a dialogue choice?  Not a problem in this game!

[h1]Combat and difficulty:[/h1]
This is a tricky one.  You are given two difficulties at the start, Standard and Hard.  A common complaint is that the game is too easy, or too hard later on.  But in actuality, most battles are puzzles with multiple solutions.  They require their own patterns to learn and defeat, making your first encounters tricky to solve.  As you advance and learn all the techniques available, it can become a breeze.  Well suited to speed-running.

Pro example: https://video.twimg.com/tweet_video/DLJaBDiWkAA_6j1.mp4

So, in my opinion, outside of boss battles and a few late areas, combat IS easy.  But playing through once unlocks a third difficulty, Challenge Mode, for you hardcore players loving torment and an achivement to go along with it.  Maybe overall combat could have been made more difficult, but imagine playing through the game by yourself thousands of times?  Being able to flow through it and enjoying replays, rather than finding a constant blockade would be much desired.  So, keep in mind this game is well suited to swift replaying, and includes a NewGame+ to encourage it.

[h1]Bosses:[/h1]
While this should go under combat, bosses are a major feature of the game.  On standard, you are given plenty of opportunity to defeat a boss on your first try while racing to keep yourself alive.  It feels good not having to die to win.  Don't spoil yourself with guides!  You can do it!

[h1]Story:[/h1]
Have you read this entire review so far?  If so, you'll have no problem reading Iconoclast's dialogue.  Let me address some common complaints: Awkward dialogue.  I don't find this to be an issue.  Yes, there is some structure and diction used that you won't find in a modern spoken conversation.  But, like my comment about a universal control scheme, does English have to fit into a small universal box?  I appreciate the occasional flowery language and it too compliments the character saying it imo.

Another common issue: Too much story.  ...Really?  Well, be happy to know most cutscenes can be completely skipped.  Which is wonderful for speedrunning.  Anyway, one of the biggest features of this game IS the story.  So, if you're cutting that out, you're really missing out.

Oh, and if you like making connections on your own.  Putting together hidden meanings, you'll have a field day with this game.  Pull back the curtain of this game and you'll find more layers awaiting.  I enjoyed piecing together what was happening rather than being given a textdump.  (Reminds me of Cave Story theories.)

PS... no voice acting.

[h1]Conclusion:[/h1]

In this age of gigabyte games, how big do you think Iconoclasts is?  ... currently 162 megabytes.  And yet, packed to the brim full of content.  To see a single person can accomplish this...  Iconclasts may not be a game for everyone.  But, what HAS been created is worth investigating.  It might just be your next favorite game too.

[b]Background on me:[/b]
Some of my favorites include: Cave Story, Iji, Kero Blaster, Wuppo, Environmental Station Alpha, INSIDE, VVVVVV, Ghost 1.0, LIMBO, Axiom Verge, Owlboy, Momodora: Reveire under the Moonlight, Unepic, 1001 Spikes and now Iconoclasts
Each one is a unique experience...

You have a wrench, which you use as both a weapon and a puzzle solving mechanic: they really roll with the full scale of the actions available, you twist bolts to open doors, you swing on bolts, you ride on electric belts and you can electrify yourself with the static electricity generated with the wrench. The wrench based gameplay was quite well thought out

......except the control scheme. To twist anything, you first need to push the wrench key, wait until your wrench connects, and then push down. A lot of keys for a simple action which you will do again, and again, and again. 

In fact, now that I think about it, this game has some really really weird control schemes. You jump onto the box and...wait for it, push UP to pick up the box: what? You can only pick up the box while you are on top of it too, you can't just push up when standing next to a box and pick it up. The only way to put it down is to throw it in which, unless you can do parabolic maths in your head, the accuracy is pretty bad. 

The platforming is highly inconsistent: some ledges you can grab, some you can't. For some reason 1 width gaps that are 1 width tall cannot be jumped into. The game also has a lot of frustrating falls where accidentally missing means a lot of lost time backtracking. For example, why is it that I can't move Mina when I crouch but Robin happily crawls along anything? Mina is also a pain to use: to shoot you need to first push the button, then select a direction, then push the shoot key again. Can't I just hold a direction key and then let Mina shoot?

I loved the fights in this game until later enemies kept breaking the rules. Every fight afterwards becomes a trial and error of: is enemy immune to wrench? stun gun? explosives? usurper? I got tired of this real fast. 

Bosses are inconsistent. The earlier bosses are great, you can figure out what they want you to do relatively quickly. The later bosses got highly inconsistent with signalling what I need to do. I had to continuously look up how to damage the boss. You can call me an idiot, but I really couldn't figure it out: How was I supposed to know I could swap out the blue goo on enemies??

Puzzles rely a lot on timing, and that's annoying. Have to get some pretty exact timings to get around certain puzzles. Especially at the start of the game, I had some real controller tossing rage moments.

Recommended improvements:
Be nice to players, implement the usual Quality of Life improvements that make the platforming much smoother. 
Some of the puzzles are real time wasters: having to angle the gun at very specific intervals and have to have some very exact timings.. Have some more tolerance for error would be nice, or at least make retries easier. 

Overall, I think it's a good game. The 8 years the developer does show. I just hope it actually plays nicer.

40249453.review:
El desarrollo estuvo a cargo por Joakim Sanberg, conocido como Konjak, le tomó 7 años desarrollarlo. El juego es una evolución de un título anterior, también creado por él,  llamado Ivory Springs, el cual posee un apartado artístico, que nos recuerda muchísimo este título, pero con Iconoclasts podemos ver una evolución tanto en el aspecto técnico, como en el narrativo.  Como curiosidad Ivory Springs fue inspirado por el fantástico Cave History. 

Controlamos a nuestra encantadora protagonista llamada Robin, poseedora de la prohibida habilidad “Mecánica”, este don está vetado por un ente superior, por lo cual debemos mantenerlo oculto. El mundo se está deteriorando rápidamente, generando conflictos entre niveles sociales del mismo planeta. Nuestra aventura gira entorno a esto, debemos entender  que está ocurriendo y nuestro papel en este hermoso lugar, con nuestra peculiar habilidad. Además entender el origen de la existente escasez de marfil, material utilizado para crear prácticamente todo.

La base del juego recae fuertemente en el estilo metroidvania, pero se inclina más por el lado del metroid. Entramos a nuestro mundo con un arma aturdidora, la cual nos ayudara a eliminar enemigos en nuestra exploración. El diseño de niveles es sencillo pero conciso. Nuestras armas tienen munición infinita, pero tiempos de recarga, un detalle es que los disparos de nuestra arma aturdidora se dirigen automáticamente hacia los enemigos, pero esto tiene rango, debes estar a determinada distancia para que esto surta efecto, y aunque esto le añade un poco de facilidad al juego, está muy bien implementado para hacer nuestra exploración satisfactoria, sin convertirlo en una experiencia sencilla.

Luego de superar algunas pantallas entra en partida una nueva arma, nuestra llave inglesa, la cual aporta el gran cambio en exploración propio del juego. Las funciones de nuestra llave son pocas pero muy concisas, lo primero que podemos hacer es ajustar o aflojar tuercas, esto nos permite activar mecanismos para seguir avanzando. También podemos atacar a los enemigos y realizar una especie de counter para poder defendernos, en algún punto podemos girar nuestra llave para recargar electricidad, modificando la exploración en algunas partes del juego. Todas estas habilidades se suman creando un conjunto de posibilidades muy interesantes, aportando mecánicas muy agradables y frescas. Después nos agregan varias armas, cada una con una personalidad marcada, habilitando así nuevos caminos en nuestra travesía, por esta razón es que tiene más inclinación por el género metroid, sobre el fantástico castlevania.

Esto también lo podemos notar en lo limitado de los menús, acá tenemos items suficientes para disfrutar del juego, no poseemos cantidades descomunales como en castlevania symphony of the night, pero necesariamente esto no es malo, ya que durante toda nuestra aventura la función de cada objeto tiene un papel importante en su jugabilidad, no son cambios pequeños, son transformaciones grandes en la exploración del mapa, pareciera que cada item se intentó explotar al máximo y aportar así, la mayor repercusión posible en el juego.

En nuestra incursión encontramos una gran variedad de enemigos, y acá podemos ver lo mismo, cada enemigo fue creado con una intención única, tanto en su agradable diseño, como cambiando la mecánica, todos poseen diferentes formas de ataque y distintas formas para ser eliminados, ofreciendo más valor a  nuestras posibilidades, este detalle simple, mantiene la aventura fresca. Pero el aspecto que si deja una sensación extraña, es una escasez de ellos, algunas pantallas se sienten vacías, pero no es un factor muy negativo, solo es la pérdida de una posible mejora en su fluidez, si encontráramos más enemigos en nuestras fases el juego resultaría más frenético o adictivo. Otro detalle es que los enemigos no arrojan items, tan solo nos dan unos cuadritos de energía para recargar nuestros potenciadores y si estamos con la salud muy baja, nos arrojaran corazones, pero cuando eres más poderoso, la exploración nos obliga a volver a lugares iniciales y esto se vuelve tedioso, ya que no tenemos suficientes motivadores extra para querer regresar a esas conocidas zonas. 

En nuestro hud disponemos en la parte superior izquierda una barra de salud, en la parte derecha el arma que está activa y abajo tenemos 3 espacios para agregar unas mejoras a nuestro personaje. Un detalle curioso es, como es habitual en este tipo de juegos, poseemos un lugar para guardar, acá tenemos unas estatuas donde grabamos nuestro progreso, aca es el único lugar donde podemos cambiar estas mejoras, no estoy hablando que entramos a nuestro menú y las activamos, no, solo las podemos modificar en el menú de la estatua, no entiendo bien porque se hizo esto, pero es una curiosidad.

Al presionar start entramos a nuestro menú, bastante básico, tenemos varias pestañas. Una donde nos muestran las armas o herramientas disponibles en el momento, otra es  el mapa y otra donde nos muestran la colección de mejoras conseguidas en el juego. Ahora para conseguir estas mejoras debes craftearlas en alguna mesa  de trabajo, que están esparcidas por el mundo. Los materiales para craftear se encuentran esparcidos en todo el mapa, la mayoría los encuentras superando acertijos o abriendo zonas que antes no podías, dedicarte a encontrar o tomar todos los materiales posibles, puede ser de gran ayuda. Las mejoras se pueden equipar, como ya dije anteriormente, en las estatuas y puedes repetir las bonificaciones obtenidas, por ejemplo si has crafteado 3 veces resistencia bajo el agua, puedes usar estas tres habilidades aumentando de forma enorme tu resistencia bajo el agua, acá las posibles configuraciones son grandes y forman parte importante para superar algunas zonas del juego de una manera más fácil.

Controlar a nuestro personaje es muy satisfactorio, el trabajo en su jugabilidad es admirable, en ningún momento sentí incomodidad o disgusto. Lo mismo en el apartado gráfico, el trabajo pixelart es fantástico, al más puro estilo 16bits. El diseño de enemigos es hermoso y los personajes del juego derrochan encanto en sus diseños. Los enemigos finales, también tienen un diseño espléndido y unas mecánicas muy bien pensadas, convirtiéndolos en inolvidables. Su aspecto sonoro es maravilloso, la música nos acompaña espléndidamente durante toda nuestra experiencia, los efectos de sonido están muy bien cuidados. Definitivamente en el apartado musical posee una personalidad potente. 

Ya por último… la historia, aunque muchos no lo crean, es el aspecto más potente del juego, el desarrollo de personajes y la narrativa es fenomenal. Su cuidada trama sorprende constantemente. Acá Joaking Sanberg hizo un trabajo increíble, aunque la jugabilidad y mecánica del juego es sólida, fue su historia la que me empujaba a avanzar, cada personaje está repleto de detalles, logrando crear ese vínculo emocional con ellos. Pero además la crítica social y política está muy bien mimetizada, no es una crítica pedante sobre la disfunción social actual. Estos temas son tratados espléndidamente por el título, es más, en algunos instantes pensaba que ese era el objetivo del juego, transmitir un mensaje social y político de forma discreta, pero agradable. Leer su historia entendiendo el trasfondo mimetizado propuesto, ayuda muchísimo a disfrutar el mensaje. Definitivamente el apartado más potente del juego, con un final, tal vez, polémico.

Iconoclasts es un trabajo maravilloso, cuando terminas el juego te deja satisfecho de muchas formas, sientes que se ha puesto amor en muchos apartados, tanto en cada mecánica y diseño de nivel, esto es gran parte del sistema viviente iconoclasts, su mundo fantástico que con mucha personalidad, detalle y sumando su exquisita banda sonora, nos hace disfrutar nuestra travesía de forma sin igual.

Iconoclasts is... fine. As a narrative-driven game, the narrative is pretty strong for the most part with lots of twists and drama, deceptively dark for what is at first glance a rather lighthearted game. As far as the gameplay though, it's pretty average at best and kinda bad at worst. Not really... awful but mediocre on the whole, I guess.

I think the big gripe I have with the gameplay is how much waiting is an element of the gameplay. Especially with the bomb gun & the puzzles builty around that, but the general pacing of the gameplay during anything besides boss battles tends to not be very... exciting. And even then, a lot of the boss battles aren't active fights, they're slow battles where you have to wait & dodge before getting a chance to attack, the worst kind of fight. The game is design as a metroidvania and I mean, kind of? The game is very much subdivided into smaller segments that are all not too large in their own right but there's some okay exploration to be had - though not much to find, since all you ever find are crafting materials and crafting recipes, and most of the tweaks save for a few of the hidden ones are not that useful. 

Character movement & combat is pretty fine though, Robin moves at a decent speed, has a decent jump, feels fine to control. The various weapons all have their uses and all work well enough. You also have a melee attack but that one's msotly pretty useless. The game also has mechanics it will outright never tell you about that are required to get some collectibles, which is... ehh. I can't say the game feels too short though, it took me around 12 hours to complete and a few extra hours past that to clean up everything I missed.

And in terms of presentation the game looks great, very vivid and colorful environments, very animated and expressive character sprites, decent variety in enemies, soundtrack's passable I guess but not super compelling. But yeah the spritework is great. I feel like the developer spent a good chunk of the game's development time just on that and it shows, but it sort of felt like it came at the expense of gameplay design quality.

I think if this developer got a few game designers to vet a lot of the gameplay ideas and trim out the weaker ones, this could've been a much better game, but as it is it's just a fine one with a pretty enjoyable (in the worst way) story. I don't regret playing it, I'd say I had a lot more fun than frustration overall, but I was never really feeling it too strongly. 40110900.review:
When you first hear something about this game, it's probably called an action platformer or Metroidvania.

Neither of those is really true.

While there are elements from both of these genres in this game, they aren't very prominent or especially well executed.
If you go into this game expecting a Metroid or Mega Man, you WILL be disappointed.
There are other areas where this game shines though, especially art and music. The sprites are absolutely gorgeous and play a big part in why the characters are so loveable, there's just small own animations for seemingly everyone. 
Which is the second point: the character design and development is amazing, and very unexpected for this kind of game.

And then there's the Story. Without spoiling too much, the initial premise of a happy, rather lighthearted game doesn't last very long, and even though the writing can be a bit weird at times ("He can't touch us if he can't touch us!") by the turning point I found myself focusing entirely on the main story just because I wanted to see what comes next. Now, granted, I am someone who loves deep and extensive lore, there might be a bit too much dialogue for other people, especially in the beginning. But then again, in my opinion this is a game you should play for its story, because that's its strongest point.

The gameplay is... well, it is what it is. The general levels are less "action platformer" and more light puzzles with the occasional medium difficulty jump or timed tech, with the more complicated stuff used to hide secrets. And boy, are there a lot of secrets. The vast majority of them are "just" chests with materials for the upgrade system - which doesn't really have THAT much of an impact aside from letting you access a few areas and some combat/speedrunning perks that are pretty helpful, but I enjoyed the challenge of finding them nonetheless. (Except that one chest in the tower. Except that one. You know who you are.)
The best parts gameplaywise are definitely the bosses, with most of them having their own gimmicks making use of all your mechanics, some of which aren't even meant for combat in the first place. There's kind of two types of bosses in this: the gimmicky ones that are basically puzzles for your various abilities, and the good old "kill them before they kill you" one on one fights against the antagonists and some other strong fighters. The optional bosses (yes, they exist. go look for them ;) include my favorite one in the entire game, which I ironcally only found in the first place because I wanted to 100% it.

So, yeah. Platforming is definitely not the point of this game, and while you can optionally use your new abilities to backtrack for secrets in earlier areas the game itself is very linear, with new areas opening up not because of your new abilities like in a Castlevania game, but because of story.
Neither is regular combat, pretty much all regular enemies are very basic and only pose a threat if you rush through them or encounter a new one you haven't met before, or when combined with environmental hazards. The bosses are fantastic though. I do recommend playing on the Harder difficulty, as even then regular enemies are laughably easy and easy may turn the bosses into cakewalks, which would take a lot away from one of the parts where this game shines the most.

If you want a game that's not too difficult gameplaywise, shines in art, music, characters and story while also giving you some puzzles and lots of secrets to hunt for, this is the game for you.

Iconoclasts is so similar to Owlboy that it is basically criminal. Art, gameplay mechanics, and even the way the story is outlined are just about the same. That is not necessarily a bad thing however, as Iconoclasts is a good game regardless.

Many of the enemies require a different combination of moves to eliminate, so it is not like the player can get through just spamming one attack.

[b]Fun boss fights.[/b] This is more an extension of the previous point, but the game also offers a variety of fun boss fights. In fact, the most difficult puzzle in the game is just figuring out how to kill the different bosses. I actually got stuck quite a few times because of this. The bosses make excellent use of the different gameplay mechanics to offer up exciting, yet sometimes challenging battles.

[b]Crazy story.[/b] The story here in Iconoclasts is on such a large scale and just does not make any sense at times, but it was an absolute blast to play through. Some of the characters encountered in the game are absolutely crazy and have some really excellent dialogue to go along with that crazy. I am sure that a lot of effort went into making this game’s story complex, yet interesting, but it came off as a comedy more than anything to me. I like to believe that was intended and, as a result, the game was much more enjoyable.

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[b]Controls can be annoying at times.[/b] One mistake I made constantly throughout the game was touching the analog stick when grabbing onto a rail. Doing so caused my character to jump off of the anchor point rather than hold onto it and glide along the rail. In order to use the rails, I had to keep my hand off of the analog stick. It did not feel right, as normally one would move the analog stick in the direction they wish to go, but in this case it can actually cause an unfair death. For a game that stresses constant movement, this aspect just did not fit in.

[b]Tweak variety.[/b] Iconoclasts includes a number of tweaks scattered throughout the game world. These tweaks, once found, can then be crafted and equipped, with the player being able to hold three at a time. The mechanic itself is nothing new, and was a good addition, but the game just lacks in variety here. The game barely has ten total tweaks, with only two or three of them actually being useful. There is only one tweak that adds anything new to the gameplay, the rest just make the game less annoying. For example, there is one that increases the player’s run speed and another that just makes it so the player can charge up their wrench in one spin rather than two. Both of these just serve to save time for the player. The game could really do with some more gameplay-changing tweaks.

[b]Wonky difficulty.[/b] There are two difficulty options to choose from at the start of the game: standard mode and harder mode. I went with standard expecting a light challenge. I was surprised to find that most of the game is painfully easy on this difficulty. Most of my deaths were due to stupid mistakes or me not realizing how to finish off a boss, rather than the fights just being difficult. I had more trouble clearing certain enemy sequences than many of the game’s bosses. Some of the later bosses were much, much easier than earlier bosses, giving so many health drops that I could tank several hits and still be fine. The difficulty was just all over the place. The “standard” difficulty would be better off relabeled as “easy” and the inclusion of a “very hard” difficulty would work wonders.

[h1]Overall:[/h1]
Iconoclasts does a lot of good when it comes to the metroidvania genre. The gameplay mechanics are slick, the enemy and boss variety is excellent, and the story is just crazy. However, the difficulty, tweak variety, and controls could use a little work. If you are a fan of Owlboy or similar games, then definitely give Iconoclasts a look.

Full review: https://cublikefoot.com/2018/02/15/iconoclasts-actual-game-review/

В начале прошлого года мне попалась на глаза Hollow Knight и она стала для меня мной года. Когда я начал играть в Iconoclasts, то думал, что ситуация повторилась, но сейчас могу сказать, что наверняка увижу игры и лучше.

Самое обидное, что на первый взгляд игра просто идеальна: графика, музыка, геймплей, персонажи просто замечательные. И если к первым у меня претензий так и не появилось, то геймплей и сюжет вызывают много вопросов.

Например, персонаж может экипировать подобие имплантов, которые дают определенные бонусы. Значительного эффекта эти бонусы не дают, за всю игру я целенаправленно менял набор два раза. Тем не менее игра подталкивает к тому, чтобы игрок искал материалы для имплантов и их чертежи - во встречающихся сундуках ничего другого и не найти . И после финального боя я обнаружил, что открыл только 50% игры. При том, что я довольно дотошно собирал всё на своём пути это означает, смог 50% контента игры находится в секретах, стимула открывать которые практически нет.

Я могу предположить, что улучшения действительно работают и становятся важны на высокой сложности (я проходил на Normal). Тогда почему автору не назвать сложный режим нормальным, а нормальный - лёгким? Зачем прятать важный кусок геймплея за путаницей в режимах? Просто я не особо хочу проходить игру заново из-за сюжета.

Сюжет (и геймплейные события, которые он вызывает) оставляет слишком много вопросов. В игре замечательные персонажи и несколько очень эмоциональных сцен, но после финала остаётся СТОЛЬКО нераскрытых вопросов, что не остаётся даже желания думать "что бы это могло значить". И знаете что? Последним боссом игры автор словно говорит "не собираюсь ничего объяснять вообще" потому что последний бой мало того что ничего не объясняет, не подводит какую-то черту, не закрывает чьи-то сюжетные линии, он вносит ещё больше неразберихи в сюжет. 

Но при этом стоит признать, что в остальном игра хороша. Геймплейные головоломки в меру сложные (хотя иногда и неочевидные), управление удобное (если забыть за захват ключом), боссы интересные. В какой-то момент игроку надо пройти пять или шесть битв с боссами подряд, кстати (и это ещё одна причина почему я не буду проходить игру на повышенной сложности). Музыка не шедевральная, но хорошая.

По итогу я могу порекомендовать игру, конечно, но чем больше времени проходит после прохождения, тем больше недостатков я в ней вижу.

40056717.review:
Iconoclasts, also known as The Iconoclasts and Ivory Springs, is a metroidvania platformer by Konjak, the guy behind things like the Noitu Love games and Legend of Princess. It tells the adventures of Robin (Alondra in Spain), a mechanic girl in a world where being a mechanic without a license is considered a sin. A society/cult/megacorp called One Concern hunts her down to put her to death for her crime. When running from the Concern, she makes wonderful friends, fights ruthless enemies and goes on an adventure to put down the cult for good.

Sounds like your average Saturday morning cartoon, right?

WRONG!

Strap yourself tight, because that's just the beginning of the story! What follows after that is a wild ride in the rollercoaster of feels as a plot that you would see on a JRPG rather than a metroidvania unfolds, all of it peppered with vibrantly colored graphics, fluid and expressive animations and a really neat soundtrack. The story alone makes it worth it.

That said, while the story is neat, the gameplay... Could use some polishing. It is not based so much around gathering abilities and fighting, but about solving puzzles. Jumping puzzles, block puzzles, switch puzzles and so on. Oh, yes, there is fighting, but I feel that the enemies are secondary to the puzzles. These puzzles can be frustrating from time to time, and, to be honest, I didn't feel very accomplished when finding out the solution to a puzzle, since they are rather obvious and simply require that you get the abilities that let you solve them. The bosses are pretty good, however, with some very memorable ones at the middle road and the final stretch of the game.

There is also a crafting system: Along the game, you gather diagrams for various upgrades you can use, as well as materials to craft those upgrades. It's a very simple system, though, and you need to equip them in slots, which get disabled as you take damage, so I felt that, other than the ones that let you take extra hits without losing life points, most of them were pointless.

To summarize, Iconoclasts is not the end all, be all metroidvania. In my eyes, that position is for La-Mulana. However, despite its gameplay having some flaws, it is entertaining for as long as it lasts, and the story is beautiful. And, what the heck, it was made by a single person over the span of 11 years! That's an accomplishment in and of itself!

You should not buy it at full price, but on a sale, even a small one, it is worth grabbing.

40056553.review:
As a fan of previous Konjak's works and someone who had relatively high hopes for this, I'm quite disappointed. It's an Owlboy's syndrome all over again: when a particular game sits quite long in the oven, but ends up lackluster after release. Iconoclasts is not *that* much dissapointing mind you, but it still made me question my 20 dollar purchase.

[i]"So what is wrong with Iconoclasts?"[/i], you may ask. The short answer is that the moment-to-moment gameplay is too shallow and its story isn't up to scratch to pick up the slack. The long answer is little more nuanced, but basically you can boil everything down to those two main aspects. The presentation (animations, sprites) don't leave a lot to be desired and music is okay-ish enough to not consider it a major point in my review.

Konjak's previous work - Noitu Love 2 - was a action-platfoming showpiece that was high-octane fun, no matter which side to looked at it. It was extremely tight in the design. In opposition, Iconoclasts' mechanics try many things at once and in the end the game overall severely lack focus where it matters the most. Game is supposedly a Metroidvania, but it lacks the level interconnection, meaningful upgrades (there are some, but they are few and far between) and you aren't really forced to backtrack that much. This on itself isn't bad - it simply means that it lacks the classic Metroidvania pacing.

Unfortunately in its place comes lackluster combat, tedious puzzles and admittedly decent boss fights. Hitting things with wrench and pistol is snappy, but enemies aren't numerous, difficulty is very forgiving and every encounter feels like on the autopilot without the expected excitement (especially with generous auto-aiming present). This, on its very own, is quite disappointing seeing Konjak's previous works, but the puzzles are the main show ruiners.

Your character is a mechanic by trade, so game tries to paint it with puzzle solving build around traversing rooms with a lot of moving, controllable platforms, blocks and screws to spin. Those are numerous and often times they are the main source of the tedium, mostly because of them being quite sizeable and hard to parse. Additionally, you character feels quite unfit for the job: always shooting block-pushing projectiles very slowly, spinning the wrench way too many times to electrify it and waiting to de-electrify said wrench when you don't want to have machinery-enabling arcs running out of you. Puzzle segments take a sizeable chunk of the playtime and they never really felt satisfying to solve, leaving the sour taste between all other attractions.

Exploration in-between puzzles also feels bad with generic rewards that are used for the upgrade crafting system that adds very little to the game. Buffs provided from this system are miniscule and unrequited, leaving the treasure chest hunt and crafting a bland endeavor.

Fortunately, most of the boss fights are great. They are big, beautifully animated and quite climactic in many instances. While normal combat often times feels quite mediocre, those encounters squeeze all the potential good from the system and turn them into quite an enjoyable moments. Some bosses are the bad examples, but the overall takeaway is that they are probably the best parts of the game gameplay-wise.

Waiting for the game to be released, I wasn't really that excited about the gameplay itself. I was very much intrigued by the story. I hoped that even if mechanics will turn out mediocre, plot will bring everything up back on its feet. I'm quite sad that this is not what really happened.

Plot is very convoluted, dialogue often times heavy-handed and the cast is pretty much unlikeable all across the board with few exceptions. Robin as a main character is often times mute and doesn't bring much to the table story-wise other than being extremely determined and helpful to others. Mina is a jerk, Elro ends up being apathetic and that leaves Royal as the only party member that despite his arrogance is at least somewhat entertaining. Side villains are also relatively fun (General Chrome especially), but their dialogue often times leaves them somewhat hard to get, especially with the poorly-telegraphed intrigue in the background. Rest of the characters fall flat, with the special case of prominent villain that enters the story quite late and leaves it as fast as a con artist with your wallet.

Story meanders and turns at below-average pace and with spotty world-building (game world is unique and extensively explained, but not to the lengths I wished for) it didn't really grab me as much I would liked to. Thankfully, the last few hours save the plot a little, by providing bigger stakes, better spotlight on the best characters and decently written conflict and struggles. While I was nonchalantly unconnected with the world of Iconoclasts for the most of the playtime, the later fragments finally grabbed me in. I risen an eyebrow on the last phase of the last boss due to ridiculous tonal shift, but overall, Iconoclasts cast and plot recovered just before the end credits.

All in all, I'm still quite negatively surprised with the game. It's by no means as bad case as Owlboy, where there was absolutely no meat to the game present, but Iconoclasts doesn't impress where it's most important and delivers the lukewarm platforming experience with the story that could use many [i]tweaks[/i] in various places. It feels like the years of development eroded the edge that every game should have to feel exciting and new. Game doesn't really bring anything new to the table and everything else feels "okay". Unfortunately, on the current market, being "okay" is not enough.

I hope that Konjak will learn heavily from this. His next project should either go in the different direction or learn from the mistakes made here. Noitu Love 3, maybe?

TLDR: EASY, SIMPLISTIC, BAD PLOT AND WORSE CHARACTERS BUT HAS CREATIVE PUZZLES AND BOSSES. IDEAL FOR NEW PLATFORMER PLAYERS OR CHILDREN, BORING FOR METROIDVANIA VETERANS.

Pros:

-Good controls, they are quick and comfortable.

-Interesting set of weapons and combat options, the delay and overload in weapons makes you observe and plan instead of mindlessly going gung ho.

-Creative puzzles. You have to use your weapons to solve them and every one fill a specific role in these puzzles. The best aspect of this game, no doubt about it.

-Bosses are built around the puzzles you can solve with your weapons, there are really interesting encounters. Other top aspect of this game. EDIT: the 2 secret bosses aren't built around this and shows.

-Pixel art and animations are really good, every character had loads of different animations and have good flow.

Cons:

-Short game. 10 hours max if you wander a little or lose some time getting upgrades. Roughly half duration of base Hollow Knight.

-The only replayability reason for now are harder runs. A boss rush would have been interesting and easy to do.

-Very, VERY, LITTLE MUCHO simplistic map. For a metroidvania the map feels linear. Small zones even compared to old Super Metroid, there are 2 "secret" bosses unlockables by doing a "find shit around the map for the lulz" which I didn't realize they were there until I read a guide. I wasn't really encouraged to stray from the path and find these myself and that kills these type of games. The worse aspect of all.

-Equipable upgrades are bad designed. Unlike Hollow Knight where charm combinations dictated your playstyle or focus, the more defining upgrades in this game are completely skippable and often worse alternatives to the typical shield upgrade for bosses and/or run speed and/or more breath. Also, they don't change gameplay much and given the upgrades can be lost by taking damage they are quite unreliable. And I personally skipped them until I read a guide because I didn't care to explore that much since everything was on rails.

-Plot. The plot becomes more and more dramatic but still feels cheesy and have some nonsensical or unexplained turns. Worse example of this is the final boss, it just doesn't make any fucking sense and is not explained at all. I know it's a tribute to other game, but ffs, IT'S THE FUCKING FINAL BOSS.

-Characters. I want to distinguish between the MC and the rest of the cast and why they fail in the mix of both. MC is the classic blank character which doesn't talk. I don't have any problems with that, the Knight from Hollow Knight is that type of character, Samus was mute too in Super Metroid and Zero Mission. But you can't make a mute character when she is not only participating in conversations but also you have to choose the answer in those conversations. We can imagine how she is more or less but when you have this much text talking directly to the MC you can't make her mute because it just gives the impression she just does whatever she is told to. Don't give us expectations of a developing character, just make conversations short and don't give options.

And the rest of the cast has their own formed persona, there are a lot of character clashes. They are way too warring and bullheaded, it's really difficult to have simpathy for them or their motivations.

Between its revealing and the final fight we could have perfectly at least 2 hours or a pair of new maps. I know this is not a big production and has been pretty much done by one person but there was a missing opportunity there, I suppose there is nothing much to do about it.

I had this same concern in Hollow Knight, the thing here is the MC is a mechanic who uses different type of devices, I'd like to see more.

-No arena. While this game's main focus isn't combat it would have been interesting having an arena like many other Castlevania games or Hollow Knight. A bit of combat expertise hard check it's always stimulating. There is only one situation in the game with that mentality but it's too short.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

While this game is underwhelming for veterans, I recommend it, specially if you haven't played platformers since this is one is easy to start in them. If you are a veteran just lower your expectations, it's not a horrible game. I hope it receives some love in form of DLC, expansion or second part, it has a lot of potential.

40040175.review:
感谢【奶牛关野蔷薇计划】提供的Key
[url=https://cowlevel.net/game/Iconoclasts/review/2978318#comment-anchor] 图文版链接 [/url]

[h1]概述[/h1]

我花了一天时间玩通了这款游戏，然后想把他推荐个每一个喜欢2D动作游戏的玩家，这款游戏对我而言是个巨大的惊喜。《反叛者们》一款质量非常高的类银河战士恶魔城式的平台动作游戏，它满足了我对于2D动作游戏的所有期待，精致的像素画美术风格、流畅的操作手感、丰富且扣人心弦剧情设置、恰到好处的战斗和解谜元素、以及数个风格独特的Boss战，这些都让我在玩这款游戏的时候欲罢不能。

[h1]也许不是这一类型的佼佼者，但绝对值得一玩[/h1]

对于类银河战士恶魔城这类别，最近几年不乏优秀的游戏作品出现，诸如前年的《公理边缘》以及去年的《空洞骑士》，客观的讲，在《反叛者们》中也许很难找到那种非常惊艳的独特设计让它能和这些前辈一样站在这一类游戏的顶端，但是这款游戏的各个方面都有着相当之高的完成的度，无论是从每个场景的关卡设计还是从文本量巨大同时诙谐幽默的人物对白中，你都能感受到作者的用心。

值得一提的是，这款游戏对于玩家的友好程度相当高。游戏中的敌人的伤害并不高，储存点也非常的多，甚至在玩家濒死的时候敌人会贴心的送上血瓶，玩家并不需要在游戏中受很多苦；同时丰富的剧情使得游戏的推进非常线性，游戏中还存在着丰富的提示信息，这些也让玩家几乎不必为迷路而担心。

当然，必须要说明的一点是正是由于上面这些设定的存在，游戏中对于地图的探索被限制在了一个相对独立的区域内，各个场景彼此联通，但缺乏逻辑上的联系，这确实让它少了些探索的乐趣。

我承认《空洞骑士》中的高自由度的开放世界设定要更加高明，但是想要把这样的游戏玩明白着实需要投入更多的精力，至少对于我来说，游戏的前几个小时还是比较痛苦的；相比之下，《反叛者们》的受众也许要更广一些，相信绝大多数玩家都可以在这款游戏中获得2D平台动作游戏简单原始的乐趣。

[h1]游戏内外的故事，都有着几分传奇色彩[/h1]

《反叛者们》的开发历程也让这款游戏增添了几分传奇色彩。这是一款由Joakim "Konjak" Sandberg一个人完成制作的独立游戏，从作者产生开发这款游戏的想法到游戏最终推出足足经过了十年时间。

如果我没有在玩这款游戏前了解到这些信息，我根本不会相信它是一款一个人开发的游戏，游戏的内容之丰富，画面之精美远超我想象。这里并不想赘述独自开发游戏的困难与艰辛，而是想说说作者的开发历程对在游戏内容上的实际反映。

丰富的剧情是《反叛者们》的一大特色，游戏中的对白文本量很大，大到几乎让我产生这是AVG的错觉，而游戏对白中也确实加入了一些不影响剧情走向的“假选择”来增强玩家的代入感。作者用一种独特的方式完成了整个游戏的开发，他在制作游戏时并没有一个宏观的规划，而是按照剧情推进的顺序线性的完成了游戏每一部分的制作。十年足以让人发生很多的变化，而作者内心世界的变化，也在这款游戏的剧情中有所体现。

"开始的时候,故事是我在刚刚进入20岁时的想法, 而到了结束的时候我已经接近30岁了。而这意味着它有个非常典型的开始，非常欢乐，有些陈词滥调，然后逐渐的向更加黑暗的方向发展。我猜也许这就是一个人心智逐渐成熟的过程吧。"

如作者所说，在游戏中，故事伴着明快的音乐开始，并一步步将一些富有内涵的话题展现在玩家面前。《反叛者们》并不是主角Robin一个人的独角戏，游戏中有多个个性鲜明的角色，丰富的对白将他们的形象塑造的较为立体。游戏中不同角色间的冲突构成了游戏剧情最有意思的部分，而作者的想法与表达也正是藏在了这样的情节之中。

[h1]风格独特却不失Metroidvania典型特征的设计[/h1]

在游戏性方面，《反叛者们》同样表现的非常出色，可以说这款游戏在保证了将类银河战士恶魔城游戏中典型玩法的同时，加入了很多带有这款游戏风格的东西，这些玩法既符合游戏的世界观，又能和平台动作游戏基础的玩法很好的结合，这是非常难得的。

游戏中最值得说的自然是主角Robin手上的大扳手，剧情上这个道具代表了主人公机械师的身份，颇具象征意义；而玩法上，这个道具更是游戏中几乎全部关卡设计的核心。游戏中的近战攻击，开关触发，长距离跳跃操作都是靠这个道具实现的。随着剧情推进，这个扳手的能力也会得到多次升级，每次升级都意味着玩家可以去到之前无法到达的地方或是能够解决新的谜题，甚至于很多敌人和Boss的击杀方式都需要利用到大扳手。可以说其他同类型游戏通过提升角色能力来实现的目的都反映在了这个扳手上。

除了扳手之外，主人公三种攻击方式不同的枪械也与游戏的关卡设计之间关系密切。游戏中的每把枪都有普攻和蓄力两种模式，除了伤害不同蓄力攻击还有着功能性的用途，很多地方都需要玩家选择合适的枪械才能通过。

由扳手的各种功能与不同枪械之间自由结合构成的体系，衍生出了非常丰富的解密方式，正因如此，该游戏相较于其他同类型游戏解谜元素占据了更大的比重。而且整个游戏过程几乎不存在重复的谜题，这足以让玩家在探索地图的时候保持新鲜感。

相比于解谜元素，游戏中的战斗系统略显单薄，游戏中的可收集元素合成的装备对游戏影响不大，体系也相对简单，游戏中的大部分战斗可能很难给玩家带来击杀敌人的爽快感。

而在地图设计上，《反叛者们》有着银河战士的典型风格，完整的地图由多个相对独立的区域构成，每个区域通过某种方式连接，彼此可达。不过由于该游戏的剧情对于驱动作用非常大，使得游戏中各个区域间的关联非常不明显。

完成一个区域的探索，触发剧情进入下一个区域，进行新的探索，整个游戏基本都是以这样的逻辑在进行，不过想想上文提及的制作者开发方式，会出现这样的问题也是比较好理解的。好在每一个区域内的关卡设计足够出色，这个问题并没有对我的游戏体验造成什么影响。

Boss战设计也是《反叛者们》突出的特点之一，游戏中的每个Boss都非常独特，每场boss战的机制都是独一无二的，有的Boss战需要玩家充分利于各种技能和不同的枪械，有的则发生在一些特殊的场景中，还有的需要玩家在角色间切换，这些Boss战都给我留下了深刻的印象。Boss的难度并不大，在了解其运作机制之后，都可以较为轻松的战胜，而学习和了解如何击败boss的工程，才是真正有趣的地方。

[h1]感想[/h1]

就我个人而言，这是一款满分作品，当然这是建立在我个人喜好的基础之上，单单游戏中精致的像素风格美术已经足以让我喜欢上这款游戏了，同时解谜和丰富的剧情都是我期待在游戏中看到的。然而即使抛开这些个人情节，我依然觉得这是一款值得推荐的游戏。某种程度上，这款游戏与《洞窟物语》非常相似（游戏难度除外！！！），同样是一个人完成的独立作品，同样是类银河战士恶魔城类型的的游戏，同样有着令人印象深刻的角色设定，同样能够带给玩家难忘的冒险旅程。曾经的《洞窟物语》在我单调的高中生活中陪我度过了数个欢乐的周末，也把我代入到了独立游戏的世界中。如今玩《反叛者们》的时候，我又回忆起了那段愉快的经历。

40027541.review:
Picture an indie pixel-art game made by a single person encapsulating all the good things of AAA development and all the bad things of AAA development and you'll end up with a pretty accurate depiction of what Iconoclasts is.

The pixel art is pretty much as good as it gets and on the same level of Owlboy in terms of details in the depiction of the various environments you find yourself crossing. 

But does it mean you'll love this game's visuals? Well yes, if what you're looking for is a hyper-detailed kind of pixel art, but sadly not quite so if you seek a more artsy product. The pixel art in Iconoclasts often feels lacking an artistic vision and, despite being impressive in terms of mere technical abilities, may fail in leaving a lasting impact.

The story, on the other hand, is pretty great for a game like this, with some memorable characters tackling deep and serious themes.

The gameplay is sadly the worst aspect of the game. Feeling fresh at first, the progression based around solving puzzles to acquire the skills needed to open the pathways to progress further gets stale pretty quickly due to a poorly balanced backtracking that will see you go endlessly back and forth through empty stages in order to proceed. The boss fights also fail to improve the overall pace of the game due to their trivial difficulty even at the highest level.

All things considered, it's a game worth playing and a quite impressive one, coming from the mind and hands of a single person, but that probably won't leave you mesmerized, unless you're part of a very strict niche of gamers looking for this kind of pixel art.

40026673.review: Iconoclasts is a peculiar combination of story-telling strategies and gameplay. Strong narrative themes of religion, family, purpose, and interpersonal interaction take center stage. The guns, moveset, puzzles, enemy and level design are all solid. There is also a good amount of speed tech for the game like jump cancelling your slide down a slope to gain horizontal speed, or turning around mid-charge shot for a boost. Iconoclasts is incredibly impressive considering how much work one man put into it, and I was surprised that it lasted me about 12 dense hours to complete my first playthrough. The injection of humor and very tragic story content can create and mixed and unpredictable tone which is not objectively good or bad but contributes to a unique flavor. 肝心のゲーム性についてはというと

メトロイドっぽいの？
キャッスルヴァニアっぽいの？

敵が進行の妨げになってたり、進むのに必須でなければ倒さなくても良い。
なのでステータスを上げたいとかアイテムをコンプしたいって人には向かないかもしれない。
一応アイテムコンプはあるにはあるが

周回プレイもあるので最初からやり直さなくても
すべての装備オプションを揃えることは出来るし

ラスボス直前になってからすべてのマップをゆっくり探索することが可能。
更にタイミングがシビアで入手制限のあるようなアイテムもないので
やり直しがめんどくさいと思ってる人は気にしなくていい。

パズル要素があるがそこまで意地悪ではないと思う。
一部本当に理解するまでに時間のかかるものもあるが…本当にごく一部。

各難易度の説明をすると
スタンダード…難易度ノーマル
ハード…与えるダメージが少し減って、食らうダメージが増える
チャレンジ…雑魚ボストラップ問わず被弾したら即ゲームオーバー

チャレンジに関してはボス戦は３発まで被弾が許される。

シンプル過ぎず、複雑すぎず、気がつけばスタンダード・ハード・チャレンジと
がっつくようにプレイしてしまった。
それでもまたプレイしたくなるのはこのゲームが本当に味わい深い内容だからだと思う。
ゲームの好みは人それぞれなのでやるもやらないも自由だけど
個人的にはマストバイなタイトルだと思うし
何年かかろうとも次回作を待ち望みます。

40011936.review:
Iconoclasts è un'avventura metroidvaniesca di indubbia qualità realizzata con passione e caratterizzata da una trama avvincente, personaggi splendidamente caratterizzati, un gameplay focalizzato sugli enigmi rispetto ai combattimenti e tante (tante) bossfights. 

Analizziamo il gioco nel dettaglio:
La [b] grafica[/b]  in Pixel-art è a dir poco stupenda, ma ciò che mi ha lasciato ancora di più a bocca aperta sono le animazioni: gli sprites sono curatissimi e adatti ad ogni situazione e ad ogni cutscene (certi sprites li vediamo una volta sola in tutto il gioco!). Nonostante la pixel art top-notch e la cura maniacale nella realizzazione della stessa, mi ha fatto storcere il naso una certa discrepanza tra i colori vivaci dei personaggi e degli ambienti e gli argomenti più "seriosi" della trama. 
La [b] colonna sonora[/b] , pur non essendo nel complesso eccelsa, regala alcune tracce memorabili specialmente nella parte finale.
Il [b] gameplay[/b]  offre puzzle ed enigmi ambientali sempre diversi anche grazie all'utilizzo di nuove armi e strumenti che otterremo andando avanti nella storia. Le boss fights sono varie e divertenti anche se abbastanza facili. Nel finale un paio di esse raggiungeranno livelli di epicità notevoli ma più per il contesto narrativo-ambientale che per la battaglia in sè. Il livello generale di difficoltà è basso nonostante si possano scegliere tre diversi livelli.
A livello metroidvaniesco mi ha un po deluso perchè il non ti invoglia a ri-esplorare le mappe una volta ottenute nuove abilità perchè gli oggetti che troviamo nelle casse hanno poco valore e i power-ups che craftiamo con questi sono poco utili. Il ritmo di gioco è abbastanza lento, personalmente avrei preferito una componente action più marcata.
[b] Longevità[/b]  nella media per un metroidvania, ci vogliono circa 12-15 ore per la prima run.

40009992.review:
Iconoclasts est un bon jeu qui m'agace beaucoup. Bon, faisons ça en trois paragraphes.

Le gameplay : C'est de la plateforme solide, mais il manque une idée marquante quelque part. On saute, on tire sur des ennemis, on casse des obstacles à coup de clé à molette. La structure du jeu est assez éloignée du Metroidvania ; certes on récupère de temps en temps une upgrade qui nous permet de retourner choper des secrets dans les niveaux précédents, mais l'aventure est très guidée. Les points de scénario nous guident d'un niveau à l'autre dans une progression linéaire, l'exploration est limitée. Les combats de boss, eux, sont variés et pas trop frustrants dans l'ensemble.

Le visuel : Le style est joli et les animations sont soignées, mais la DA manque quand même d'inventivité. Les designs de personnages sont sympas, mais les décors sont très conventionnels. Une forêt, un désert, des couloirs... Il y avait moyen d'injecter un peu plus de piquant là-dedans. C'est pareil pour les ennemis : les boss proposent bien des designs un peu fouillés et plus frappants, mais les monstres et autres soldats sont vraiment quelconques.

L'histoire : On en arrive au point névralgique. Iconoclasts est fortement inspiré de Monster World 4 et met son scénario en avant encore plus que son prédécesseur. Il y a plein de scènes de dialogues entre personnages majeurs et mineurs, la progression est régulièrement entrecoupée par des set pieces et des scènes d'action non interactives. Attention, qu'on soit bien clair : ce n'est pas un défaut ! Au contraire, j'apprécie tout ce qui est jeu narratif. Non, là le problème, c'est que tout est fouillis dans cette histoire. Il y a des idées intéressantes et de bonnes surprises, mais il manque bien cinq ou six passes d'edit pour en faire un récit qui tient debout. Les dialogues sont parfois trop vagues et sybillins, ou juste étrangement formulés. Tout le lore sur les événements passés et la raison d'être de cette société est volontairement obscur et reste en retrait par rapport à l'aventure des héros. Des flashbacks et des moments tragiques surviennent un peu n'importe quand, sans grand effet. Les motivations des personnages sont floues et leurs arcs se terminent en queue de poisson. C'est tellement dommage ! Il y a quand même un chouette récit d'aventure au cœur de tout ça, avec des persos bien démarqués et une montée dans les tours sur la fin, mais ça sonne toujours un peu faux, maladroit.

Et malgré tout ça, je peux pas dire que j'ai passé un mauvais moment. La fin est intense, les niveaux sont plaisants à parcourir, il y a des secrets planqués un peu partout. Un bon jeu, donc, mais qui aurait pu être mieux.

Iconoclasts - игра, выхода которой я ждал с того самого момента, как узнал о ней и ее создателе. Это его магнум опус, разработка которого заняла целое десятилетие, и в который он вложил свои душу и амбиции. В этой игре чувствуется присутствие чего-то глубоко личного, и оттого, наверное, она оставляет такое необычное впечатление.

Пожалуй, я не буду посвящать весь обзор перечислению достоинств и недостатков. Восхитительный пиксель-арт, отличная музыка и захватывающий гладкий геймплей - все это вы и сами можете увидеть уже по одному только трейлеру, все эти аспекты сильны на протяжение всей игры. Наверное, люди, ожидающие от этой игры метроидвании будут несколько разочарованы, поскольку, хоть игра и построена на манер метроидвании (с картами, секретами, бэктрекингом и прочими прелестями жанра), в ней больше идет уклон в сюжет и в паззловую составляющую, нежели в прокачку персонажа и поиск апгрейдов. Некоторое разнообразие в этом плане предоставляют так называемые "твики", которые дают герою определенные бонусы и умения, но, честно говоря, их подача в игре оставляет желать лучшего и на сам процесс они не особо влияют.

Но это не самое важное, что нужно сказать об этой игре. Самое важное - тот опыт, который она дает игроку. Можно, конечно, просто сказать, что "игра не для всех", но, думаю, все же надо уточнить, иначе зачем вообще было затевать это словоизлияние. 

Скажу сразу: игра на удивление продолжительная. Нет, естественно, есть игры и подольше, да и пройти ее можно куда быстрее, чем я, но не в этом суть. Вам лучше приготовиться к тому, что вы не будете знать, куда именно сюжет будет вести и где именно он будет заканчиваться - хорошо это или плохо, решать вам самим. Iconoclasts - игра с довольно тяжелым багажом неоднозначных идей, мотивов и сюжетных линий, так что будьте готовы и к тому, что вы не будете знать, как относиться к ней во время и после ее прохождения. Вполне возможно, что кто-то испытает разочарование или даже некое отторжение и апатию от вещей, которые игра отдает на суд игроку. Кто-то наоборот найдет в этом главное очарование игры и испытает катарсис от осознания заложенного в нее смысла и сопереживания персонажам. Ну а кто-то запутается в хитросплетениях сюжета и мало что поймет, но это тоже не беда, благо это игра, а не фильм или книга, и занимательное времяпровождение все равно гарантировано.

Iconoclasts - это мир теорий и сомнений, где нет правильных решений и идеальных людей. Мир, в котором все не то, чем кажется, и не то, во что можно верить. Я рекомендую эту игру всем, ибо я получил от нее большое удовольствие и пищу для ума, но не берусь сказать, каково будет ваше собственное впечатление от нее. Впрочем, не в этом ли весь интерес?

To preface this, I had around zero expectations for this game. I had only heard of it a few months ago and thought the art look nice. Then I heard that it was like Cave Story and Owlboy and decided to pick it up. Just wanted to put that out there since I've been seeing what I think are people having set unrealistically high expectations for it.

To start off, the art is great! It immediately gave me vibes of Owlboy with how detailed the art and animations were. The dev really put work into those. The environments are quite nice, albeit feeling like I was seeing the same texture within the zones. The performance is great as well. I was running it on my laptop and only had a frame drop when I had a Windows Defender notification. The music is also pretty sweet too, ranging from happy tunes to intense melodies as the story progresses.

The gameplay surprised me in this. I love myself some good bosses and the bosses are all genuinelly unique and interesting. I was continually surprised at how cool I felt the boss designs and encounters were, if you are going to play this game for anything, the bosses are one of the highlights!

The other stuff that you do during gameplay is pretty much your standard 2D action puzzle/platformer fare, though that's not a knock on that by any means, it's really well executed and the puzzles are genuinelly challenging and fair. It just doesn't appeal to me as much.

The story was what surprised me the most about this game! I don't get invested in stories and characters that often. You can imagine my surprise when I found myself not wanting to put the game down for the sake of finding out what happened next, and what was going to befall those characters. Also, special shoutout to the dev for making Black such a compelling villian and character. Her arc is in my opinion, one of the best and saddest things that I've played through since NieR: Automata. 

All in all I found Iconoclasts to be a pleasant surprise! If you like games like Owlboy and Cave Story which focus more on the narrative and having more of a scripted and paced feel, then don't hesitate to pick this one up when you are able.

39841696.review:
Iconoclasts is a game of two halves, or more accurately 2/3 and 1/3. It starts out FANTASTIC. The game looks amazing: the graphical style isn't just your bog standard 16 bit retro style, but a more evolved pixel look. The soundtrack is great, the controls are fairly tight and the Metroidvania elements are paced just right. I constantly felt like I was progressing at a steady pace and the constant drip of new abilities allowed me a nice loop of advancing the story, going back to get some treasures I couldn't reach before, and then repeating.

The story is more mature than most in games, and deals with fairly heavy stuff like organized religion and the complicated mess that is personal relationships, be they between siblings, lovers or parents and children. For the first 2/3 of the game I was enthralled and really loving the game.

Sadly, Iconoclasts kind of outlasts its welcome. Towards the end of the game some of the encounters and fights start to feel frustrating, some of the boss fights might be interesting as ideas but poor as far as execution goes and generally I felt more and more like the game should've ended already. My frustration was mounting and I found myself just waiting for it all to end, more out of obligation to finish the game I'd already sunk 8 hours into than a real desire to see where it all ended up.

After completing the game I am happy I did so, because Iconoclasts does stick the landing. It could've benefitted from tighter editing (chopping off an hour or so would've done the game wonders) and I found some pretty strange bugs (after about halfway through the game I kept finding new Tweak blueprints but they never appeared on my crafting menu) and so on. For a game made essentially by a single person Iconoclasts is a remarkable achievement, especially considering the engine its built on. I'd say overall it's worth playing, but with some tighter editing and probably a bit wider outside testing it could've been an amazing game. Now it's about 2/3 of one.

They're clearly incredible labors of love, but in the end both are merely good rather than great. I did like Iconoclasts a bit more though, mostly due to its more ambitious narrative.

Mechanically, Iconoclasts is pretty good, with some really fun boss fights and a small but interesting set of weapons that double as puzzle-solving tools, but it doesn't do anything particularly ground-breaking in that regard. Personally, I found far more enjoyment in the narrative end of things. The game doesn't really explain its world much at first, preferring to drop you in the middle of things and let you piece things together as you go. To make matters worse, though most of the writing is good, some of the dialogue is kinda clunky, possibly because the developer is from Sweden so English isn't their first language, and the game wasn't really clicking with me as a result. However, after I pushed through for a couple hours, I started to actually get properly invested in the world and characters. By the end, I actually cared enough that I genuinely felt bad for a certain boss while I was fighting them, which is a testament to Iconoclasts' writing and characterization.

39800219.review:
Iconoclasts is a wonderful and charming example of a solid 2D action and puzzle game. It's not exceptional or amazing, but it doesn't do anything wrong either. You control a young woman named Robin, who has an interest and a knack for mechanics and technology. Sadly, however, in this world, technology is tightly controlled and holy, so fixing or knowing about them is against the divine authority. 

The story is quite basic, girl gets in trouble with authorities, runs away, makes new friends and the friends uncover secrets of the world almost by accident while helping other friends. But the story works, the characters are interesting with clear personalities, which are kept throughout the game and are shown in dialogue and actions of said characters. The world and its lore are introduced in good chunks with a good interval between action. Art is charming and the beautiful world enhances the experience. Only noticeable annoyance in world building is the size of the cast. A lot of characters are introduced, but there are quite a few that nothing is done with, they just disappear when you scroll to the next screen.

Game mechanics are solid with a good amount of variety. Different equipment is used throughout the game as upgrades are made available. The puzzles don't offer much of a brain tease, but they do not repeat themselves and do ask somewhat agile actions from time to time. Boss fights are numerous and interesting. Many bosses have quite unique mechanics that require the use of different tools to defeat them. However, for experienced gamers I do recommend skipping the standard mode as the game is quite forgiving on taking damage and boss fights can be a bit too easy as they require a lot of hits to take you out.

Overall, I do recommend Iconoclasts for anyone looking for a solid 2D action platformer and some puzzles.

Congratulations to Joakim, on a long project completed.  One of the few games I felt no compunction paying full price for, to support a solo developer.
On to my thoughts-

39753544.review:
Iconoclasts reminds me a lot of Owlboy – a narrative heavy, achingly beautiful puzzle platformer that looks amazing but sadly just isn’t all that interesting to play. Like Owlboy, laying into Iconoclasts is painful because of how much effort has clearly gone into the game. This is a ten year project and is the effort of a single creator, and tearing into such a stunning piece of pixel art kind of breaks my heart.

I think part of my lukewarm opinion of the game stems from my own expectations, which is perhaps a little unfair. As a linear puzzle/platformer punctuated by spectacular boss fights, Iconoclasts isn’t bad at all though I’d say it never really strays into greatness. The controls are slick, the puzzles and combat are mostly well designed (if a little repetitive), and while I was never amazed it all comes together quite nicely.

However, all the reviews of the game paint it as a metroidvania and if that’s what you’re after then Iconoclasts kind of sucks. There’s maybe five upgrades doled out through the game over its generous 12-15 hour runtime, and some of those are minor upgrades to previous tools. The rest of the collectables are schematics and materials to build “tweaks” – little upgrades that you can apply to your character. You can equip three, and they’re things like slightly faster movement speed or slightly more damage. They make so little difference they might as well not be there. There are no upgrades to health, tweak slots or indeed anything that might actually make you want to seek out any of these secrets.

The other big selling point of Iconoclasts is the narrative, which is a shame as the writing is straight up awful. Scenes seem to go on endlessly with clunky, poorly translated dialogue straight out of Golden Sun, and you bet your ass there’s some terrible attempts at humour too. The plot itself is almost incomprehensible, partly because of the rotten dialogue and partly because the game neglects to actually explain what anything in this fictional world actually is or how any of it works. Like Final Fantasy XIII there’s a large degree of assumed knowledge and everything is packed with nonsense terminology. Several scenes that I’m sure were supposed to be shocking twists fell completely flat, particularly concerning the infighting within the enemy faction as I wasn’t even aware there WERE subfactions until the inevitable betrayal.

As a last complaint Iconoclasts seems to forget what type of game it is for the last 2-3 hours. Prior to that point it was a somewhat relaxed puzzle platformer with the occasional high octane boss fight to break things up. Near the end the game becomes a nonstop combat and boss gauntlet and the pacing goes out of the window. As set pieces the bosses are a lot of fun, but throwing you up against five in a row is just tedious and exhausting. I will say however that the difficulty curve does seem to be generally well calibrated, and on standard difficulty Iconoclasts might actually be a little on the easy side.

In conclusion, if you loved Owlboy (and it certainly had plenty of fans), then you’ll almost certainly enjoy Iconoclasts as they share the same facets (or flaws, if you’re feeling less charitable). I found the writing clunky and obtuse, others may enjoy the wordiness and ambiguity. I found the metroidvania aspects shallow and irrelevant, but you may find the direct, linear story appealing. So overall, I didn’t love Iconoclasts, but I didn’t hate it either – it’s just, you know, alright.

An amazing and lovingly crafted platformer that was a joy to play through. There was a lot packed into this experience, and my first run took about 12 hours. It posed a comfortable challenge, and rarely felt unfair. The puzzles were interesting, and kept mixing in new elements that kept things fresh. I enjoyed the deep story, and a lot of the characters were pretty well fleshed out; although I did find myself liking the side characters a lot more than the main cast, who tended to irritate me at times. I liked Mina as a character, but she wasn't nearly as fun to play as Robin, as she felt somewhat stiff to control. This was particularly glaring at one point in the game where she gets an auto-scrolling section, which was a little frustrating due to how awkward it was to shoot down some of the hazards. Nearing the end of this game, and I finally feel like I can write a decent review. 

While I wasn't one of the people who watched the (long) development of Iconoclasts, the gameplay and premise immediately drew me in and kept me playing. I'll put it this way: I pre-ordered Monster Hunter: World and have only played it once, since I wanted to finish this game first.

Iconoclasts mixes metroidvania style gameplay with puzzle platforming, though it goes far heavier into the puzzle side of things than the combat. Even boss battles are really puzzles, requiring thought and strategy to overcome. The game itself is beautiful, featuring a story that--while certainly not lacking in social commentary--manages to pull off an engaging narrative with memorable, multi-faceted characters at the helm. 

This isn't an especially difficult game in Normal mode. It's not easy, but you won't typically find yourself stuck on a section for longer than a few tries. Puzzles are just nuanced enough to make you feel smart for solving them on your own, and boss battles are creative and fun enough to be enjoyable even if you die a few times trying to figure them out.

I would recommend Iconoclasts to anyone who enjoyed Cave Story, and anyone who enjoys puzzle platformers in general. It's a fantastic game and, like a good novel, I'm wishing I wasn't near the end.

IC - та штука, от которой я ничего изначально не ждал, ибо узнал о ней всего-то за месяц до выхода, может полтора. Но, весьма интригующий трейлер с приятной музыкой и милой героиней, намёки на сюжетную метроидванию, приятный глазу пиксель-арт - всё это ощущалось чем-то вкусным, посему на выходе не раздумывая взял и опробовал.

Что можно сказать по итогу?

Пожалуй, хвалебных отзывов игра заслуживает сполна, я же заострю внимание на некоторых моментах. Эдакий разбор полётов.

1. Прокачка в игре представлена так называемыми "твиками". И реализация этой прокачки спорная. За несколькими исключениями твики представляют собой бонус к какому-то эффекту или характеристике. При всём при этом, твик должен быть заряжен. Заряжется он фрагментами от статуй или поверженных врагов. Если по тебе попадают, зарядка твика слетает, бонус или эффект пропадает. Это нормально, позволяет играть осторожней. Но, если серьезно, бонус твика такой слабый, что им можно было бы пренебречь вовсе. Слабый эффект твика - моя претензия. Делать многотвиковую связку из бонусов смысла нет. Можно вообще их не трогать и...ничего не поменяется. Точнее нет, например 1 твик на продление вращения гаечного ключа позволяет заряжать последний за одно полное вращение (без твика нужно заряжать двойным вращением с паузой между ними, одно чутка недозаряжает). Также полезным окажется твик на увеличение запаса воздуха (и то 1 раз за игру). И всё. Если испытываете трудности с боссом, то можно накидать твики на разовую защиту от урона в размере до трех штук. И вот тут и есть проблема моей претензии. бонусные твики нужно было делать прокачиваемыми, тогда бы все они приобрели куда больший смысл, позволив сделать себе ту Робин, которая подойдет в нужной ситуации или вообще. А то выходит, что от одного твика бонуса толком и нет, а забивать все три слота однотипными твиками как-то глупо. Тем более среди твиков есть действительно полезные штуки - это и уворот с нижней позиции и дабл-джамп и другие. Они ощущаются полезней, потому что дают видимый и полезный эффект. И вот тесно связанная с ними моя вторая претензия. Все не бонусные твинки, дающие заметные эффекты даются за квесты.

2. В игре кроме основного квеста есть мини-квесты, которые дают некоторые персонажи. И эти мини-квесты нигде не пишутся (хотя, возможно, я просто тупенький и не нашёл). Про них очень легко забыть и потом не понять, а куда и кому это надо? Тем более игра слишком подгоняет тебя идти по сюжету. И тут стоит всё же сказать, что игре недостаёт некоторой свободы. С одной стороны это нормально из-за большого упора игры на сюжет,  но с другой это херит метроидванию как таковую. Те же ресурсы или твики ты открываешь не ради собственно твиков (они стоят n-ресурсов) и бонуса, а за счет небольшой головоломки, что им предшествует. То есть процесс превалирует над результатом. И это лишает игру реиграбельности (вы часто переигрываете квесты и перечитываете детективы?). Нет, метроидвания, платформеры и тем более сюжетная игра далеко не всегда обязаны быть реиграбельными. Но когда на примете есть игра, пусть и с фансервисным сюжетом, но с огромной кучей механик, тонкостей, сложностей и дикой реиграбельностью на сотни часов - это всё бросается в глаза. Игру не интересно зачищать, а после прохождения её не интересно переигрывать, увы. Чуть не забыл, при наличии карты, в игре нет мини-карты, что несколько неудобно. Да и сам левел-дизайн не во всём удачный. "Быстрый" переход между локация сделан забавно, но потом будет напрягать потерей времени. Локации же за исключением двух локаций - очень горизонтально растянутые, что начинает напрягать и, собственно, опять же сбивать желание исследования.

3. IC - игра сюжетная. Моя третья претензия к некоторым вещам с ним связанными. Это не совсем спойлеры, но я их всё равно спрячу, ибо может подпортить вам игру. [spoiler]Игра начинается в достаточно комедийном ключе, но после определенного момента в игре пропадает юмор. При этом драматизм и трагизм истории еще недостаточно развился. Посему на определенном этапе будет весьма скучный сюжетный провис. В игре вообще хватает скучной болтовни, но по большей части она необходима, да и не в ней претензия. Претензия же в том, что тот накал драматизма, что будет в последней трети игры идёт в один известный женский орган, увы. К финалу игры вы будете сидеть и думать, что вас где-то обманули. Похерено это будет всего лишь одной вещью и я не понимаю, почему. Комедийный ключ, свойственный первой трети игры давно забыт, драма на максималках и тут вот это. Ни объяснения, ни пояснения, твист, маленький комедийный кусочек, догадка и всё похерено. И после этого сидите у разбитого корыта. Ведь можно было даже это обыграть это будь здоров как на почве лейтмотива сюжета - религии и фанатизма. Но нет. 39730776.review:
Ver.1.12にて、色々とうろつきながら進めて約11時間半で初回クリア。初周で収集要素全回収まで約16時間。全実績解除まで約35時間所要しました。

[h1]Pros:[/h1][list]
[*]滑らかな操作性
[*]美しいドットグラフィックスとアニメーション
[*]耳障りのない心地よいサウンド
[*]魅力的で個性的なキャラクター達
[*]攻撃パターンの豊富なボス戦
[*]程よく悩ましいパズル[/list]

[h1]Cons:[/h1][list]
[*]カスタムの反映が分かりづらい[/list]

[h1]優れた操作性を持つシナリオ重視のメカニック女子2Dアクション[/h1]

　私がIconoclastsを知ったのは昨年の5th of BitSummitに展示されていたのを見たときが初めてでした。緻密なドット絵がぬるぬる動く様子を見て、発売されたら絶対買おうとその場で決意。普段はどれだけ周回遅れになろうと気にせずあまり定価買いはしないのですが、本作は先述の経緯もあって発売日に定価で購入しました。結論から言えば、その判断は間違っていなかったと思います。満足。

　本作の見た目は実に華やかです。SFC全盛期を思わせるような画面のつくりは、UIを含めて見ているだけでとてもワクワクします。7年かけて単独開発したと巷で言われているのもあって、ただただ驚くばかりです。静止画でも十分美しいですが、動かした際のキャラクターアニメーションの演技は本当に優れていると思います。待機モーションなどは勿論のこと、イベントで肩を寄せて抱き合うシーンなどの拍子、リズムがとても丁寧に描写されていて見ててなんか凄くいいなと感じました。

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1278893386

　特筆すべきは操作感がとても優れていることです。アクションゲームで思い通りに動かせることはとても大切なことだと個人的には捉えています。変な移動慣性もなく、入力と反応の誤差が無いのでとても素直なプレイ感覚を得られました。プレイ中に入力を妨げるような処理落ちなども一切感じられず、最適化の面でも度重なる調整をされたことが窺えます。そうしたフィーリングを後押しするようにピコピコと弾むような足音のSEはとても可愛らしく歩くだけでも楽しさを伝えてくれます。

　ボス戦も実に魅力的です。ボスのライフが減少している程度によって攻撃パターンが変化するので、新しいボスに出会うたびパターン構築のしがいがありました。接近して使用するレンチは攻撃のリーチこそ短いものの試してみると色んな攻撃を弾き返せるので、銃(スタンガン)もいいんだけどとりあえず殴ってみる(物理)という野蛮な思考こそ至高です。やっぱりメカニック女子はこうでなくちゃね。他の色んなアクションゲームで棒立ちだったり、モブと化す味方NPCが、本作では結構ボスの弾を迎撃したり、ダウンまで奪ってくれたりと奮闘してくれるところもボス戦の見どころだったりします。

　明るいビジュアルに反して描かれる物語はちょっと重たいです。本作の世界にはアイボリーと呼ばれるエネルギー源があり、これを用いて生活を支える機械を稼働させています。普段このエネルギー源は電池という形で区画ごとに配給されており、登録なしに無断でアイボリーに触れることは禁じられています。このエネルギー源はワン・コンサーンと呼ばれる武装した宗教組織が牛耳っており、実質上世界を支配しています。組織の教義から著しく逸脱した家庭には「聖罰」がくだり、一家ごと誅殺されるというトンデモ世界なのです。主人公であるロビン(マザーグースの一篇でも知られるよう、愛称はコマドリ)はワン・コンサーンのメカニックであった亡き父親のレンチを隠し持っており、そこからゴタゴタに巻き込まれていくことになります。

　シナリオは人によっては少々とっつきにくいかもしれません。聖罰の下らない選ばれた民だけが住むことのできる街なんて、いかにもな宗教による選民思想で個人的には大満足なんですが、陣営の思惑やイデオロギー、思想などが頻出するため、堅苦しく感じたり、陳腐に感じる方がいらっしゃるかもしれません。またアクションゲームとして見ると、操作性の良さはありますがシナリオ偏重で後半になるまで一本道の展開となっているため、投げてしまうとせっかくの優れた演出の数々を見失う可能性はあります。勿論過度に重くならないようキャラクターはとても魅力的な掛け合いを行いますし、初見では感情移入しづらい敵陣営の背景などが後々描かれることで、リプレイした際にこのときはこういう意図で話していたのね、と改めて発見することがあります。私は好き！

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1278893461

　マップごとの各エリアは画面端まで移動すると遷移するメトロイドヴァニア方式ですが、初期の探索範囲は広くなく、またシナリオ進行に伴って一時的に後戻りできないシーケンスが続くため、序盤では開けられない宝箱などが見えると、それが今開けられるものなのかどうかの判断がつきにくいです。後半で自由にエリア間移動ができるようになった際に収集要素はコンプリートできるようになっているため、これからプレイされる方は時限的な要素はないので安心してください。またパズル要素は新しいマップに訪れる度に新しいギミックが登場し、結構頭を悩ませます。それなりには悩むものの、どうしようもなくなって詰まることはなかったのでいい按配だったと思います。

　ユーザビリティ的な観点から言及すると、イベントなどでのデモスキップはちゃんと搭載されており、画面上下に黒帯が出るような演出は大体スキップできるようになっています。リトライはゲームオーバー後に即リトライとセーブから再開を選択でき、画面右下に兵士のアイコンが出るところからリトライで再開できます。ボス戦など繰り返し行う可能性がある箇所で即リトライができるようになっているのはとてもありがたかったです。リトライすることでの実績的なペナルティなどはありませんので積極的な活用を推奨します。

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1278893439

　唯一残念だったのはカスタムの装備反映が分かりづらかった点です。カスタムとはパッシブのスキルスロットのようなもので、そのエリア特徴を捉えたカスタマイズを施せばそれなりに有利に戦えるようになります。ただカスタムはダメージを受けることによって3つのスロットのうち右側から無効化されていきます。1回ダメージを受けても無かったことにするカスタムがあるのですが、こちらを仮に一番左に1つだけつけていても前2つのカスタムが無効化されない限り効果を得られない仕様が分かりづらかったです。一周クリアしたあとに解禁される一発ダメージを受けたら即死するゲームモードで、この事実に気付かずラスボスまで進めてからこの事実を知って愕然としました。そこに至るまでのオートセーブが発生しない三連続ボス戦の3時間はなんだったのか…。


　ドットベースのゲームであるためVer.1.13時点で162MBとコンパクトなサイズであり、常にHDD容量を気にしながらインストールとアンインストールを繰り返している私もこのゲームはインストールしたままになりそうです。ゲーム中の表現で身体の部位欠損が描写されるところがあり、そこがお子様対象だとどうかなと思うところもありますが、ドットグラフィックなので幾分マイルドに抑えられていると思います。プレイしてこんなに気持ちのいいゲームは久しぶりだったので、もっとたくさんの人にこのゲームを知ってもらえるといいなぁと思います。操作感の優れたアクションゲームをお求めの方には特にオススメ！
